conclusion: Identical steel balls are released from the same position every 0.1 seconds with zero initial velocity.
The photograph shows the positions of several balls at a single moment with AB = 15 cm and BC = 20 cm.
The task is to analyze the motion of these balls.
The balls are under constant acceleration due to gravity along the inclined plane.
Position equation for constant acceleration starting from rest: x = (1/2)at^2.
Ball C was released first, Ball B was released 0.1 seconds after C, and Ball A was released 0.2 seconds after C.
BC = 20 cm and AB = 15 cm from the image.
Ball C's position: x_C = (1/2)at_C^2, Ball B's position: x_B = (1/2)a(t_C + 0.1)^2, Ball A's position: x_A = (1/2)a(t_C + 0.2)^2.
x_B - x_C = BC = 20 cm and x_A - x_B = AB = 15 cm.
Subtracting equations gives -0.01a = 5, so a = -500 cm/s².
Acceleration is positive, so a = 500 cm/s².
Substituting into equation gives t_C = 0.35 seconds.
Ball A's time is t_A = t_C + 0.2 = 0.55 seconds.
Additional balls above Ball A were released at 0.1-second intervals after Ball A.
Final answer: acceleration is 500 cm/s², Ball C has been rolling for 0.35 seconds, Ball B for 0.45 seconds, Ball A for 0.55 seconds.
